attributes.action: Let's pay our NHS Nurses a fair salary for the work they do.
attributes.additional_details:
Nursing salary has not even kept up with inflation. 

In 2010, a starting (not average) pay for a newly qualified nurse was £21,200; it is now £24,200. Factoring inflation, this is a 5% decrease.  MPs’ pay rose from £66,000 in 2010 to £79,500 in 2020. Factoring inflation MP pay has increased by 2%.

https://fullfact.org/online/public-sector-salaries/

I want to correct this by an immediate one off salary increase for all nurses of 10%.  There must be no impact to the Agenda for Change proposals.
attributes.background:
Nurses in the UK are significantly underpaid for the work that they do.

For example, a nurse in the UK earns on average £25,653 compared to £38,535 in a similarly developed country, Australia. 

https://www.yourworldhealthcare.com/au/news/are-nurses-better-off-in-the-uk-or-australia

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, calling for similar actions:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315297
